comments.text: I wish more people would give this anime a chance.  It is unlike any other anime out recently by sticking to its roots with pure adventure fantasy.
I hear you, I'm gonna watch one episode.
This is exactly what I keep telling my friends. No one wants to listen though
The closest equivalent I can recall recently is Tales of Zestiria, which got bogged down in its mythology and lost track of the plot, especially in the 2nd season.
Hmm. That show must have flown by under my radar. I'll check it out.

Agreed, they didn't feel the need to put in romcom or drama, and instead focus on the characters, with a simply described yet beautiful world. It's one of my favorites from this season and I'm surprised so few people are watching this.

Even if they put a little romance is probably gonna be lyria x gran, and the show has been masterfully poiting out how they're attached to each other SO naturally and fluid that is almost unnoticiable.

Pure adventure fantasy with a vaguely steampunk swords-and-sorcery setting, one or more plot-relevant summoner characters, an airship for the party to use after the linear introductory portion of the plot, an unpleasant empire, and a Nobuo Uematsu soundtrack? All it needs are some chocobos and more frequent random encounters to complete its existence.

If Lyria's ~~ahegao~~ ahoge is pointing towards Gran I *wonder* which part of Gran's body is pointing towards Lyria

[](#smugrose)
If these doujins I read (holy shit you guys, there is a lot of these things) are to believed, it's pointing off in whatever direction this Narmaya person is in.
My thoughts exactly.

Some more in game Mary art (the redhdead girl) for those who want more of her:

WAIT THERES IDOL MARY?!!!!! HOLY FUCK
It's a skin you can buy for her.
is it not in the gatcha roll?
Nope. It's just a skin that cygames sells once in a blue-moon.

FUCK
I HAVE NO MONEY FOR THAT SKIN OF MY WAIFU
and [Lyria, Djeeta, and Vira](http://www.sosgamers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/Granblue-Fantasy-Kimi-to-Boku-no-Mirai.jpg) :)
MY SOUL NEEDS THESE SKINS!!!!

I'm totally in love with this episode. 

They actually made an episode that was reminiscent of side quests in FF's. Comedy was amazing in this, i laughed way too much. 

Rackam and Io's little disputes can stay please, great fun to see those two. 

Gran finding a better sword for himself as a reward for a side quest, FUCK YES! 

The characters all grew on me in this episode by a good bit <3
The comedy was so on point this episode, I wouldn't be surprised if the writer was someone different from the previous episodes.

"Stephen Curry my ass nigga" -Gran

Damn, this show is slowly becoming my favorite anime of the season, cute girls, bad ass action scenes, Katalina, not recap episodes and Katalina.
[steph curry my ass](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rko6oBuZb1c)

Ohhh, sexy and fun girls, [i like these two already!](http://i.imgur.com/XNarFra.png)

[Lyria's ~~ahoge~~ ahegao can move!](http://i.imgur.com/J76BSO5.png)

[Gran with those basketball skills, though](http://i.imgur.com/li4Xgqs.png)

[Ahhh, they are great!](http://i.imgur.com/r160cpF.png) too bad we probably won't see more of them u.u

> Lyria's ahoge ahegao can move!
> 

Found that scene to be adorable!

> Ahhh, they are great! too bad we probably won't see more of them u.u

I really thought they were going to join up :(
and apparently Lyria's Ahoge points to Gran as her magnetic North. acceptable.
They might be recurring characters if this series gets a lot of seasons (and it might)
In the game they do, but they are side characters. They aren't even in the main story, so I was surprised they gave them an episode.
Mary is sorta popular though
Narmaya episode confirmed!
my good sir, do not tease me like this
I think I would die if they announce a Dragon Knights episode.
That slide after the dunk was hilarious. Io totally carried the team though.
She's got a Gran Positioning System
new in world phase coined: a Gran Dunk.
Come on and Slam! And Welcome to the Gran(cypher)!

Pretty sure about where Gran got his dunking skills.
http://i.imgur.com/mPoCNvi.png

This episode sums up every Granblue Fantasy players... All that work, just for some potentially fodder weapon.

Also, RIP Clay Golem. May your troll SR rates and 2/2 unevolved body rest.

This show just remains so pleasant to watch. The intensity is low but the cast and adventure just make it fun. [From cute Katalina](http://i.imgur.com/Q1W5iDC.jpg), to the bickering between Io and Rackam to [SLAM DUNK](http://i.imgur.com/lTedMFi.png) it's just easy to watch. 

Sad that the duo didn't end up joining them though, they were pretty [cute](http://i.imgur.com/0rRGlVq.png).
[Io and Rackam](https://i.imgur.com/nYjwK1s.jpg) are cute together ! They seem like brother and sister. the variety of their interactions (fighting, supporting, admiring) is very pleasant to watch.
I expected Io to be best girl from the moment I saw her in the opening, and she has not disappointed.

> This show just remains so pleasant to watch. The intensity is low but the cast and adventure just make it fun. 

I really agree with this.  I love that the show is just a solid, fun adventure show with an entertaining cast and competent writing- there's no gimmicks or meta jokes and it's not like it's trying so hard to be unique and different that it forgets what it is.  I honestly wish we had more straightforward adventure shows like this.

> meta jokes

You could say the series itself is a meta joke. It's just one massive JRPG in anime form and it's so good at doing that.

This series manages to capture the spirit and atmosphere of playing RPG better than any of those gimmicky stuck in MMO shows. This episode made me want to go back and play some sidequest in one of the older FF games. Sometimes simple and "generic" but well executed is better than trying too hard to write something original by jumping all over the place with the ideas.

I really love how ''chill'' they were fighting the clay golem, not overeacting, the reactions of all the characters were esplendid this episode, all of them showing a little bit more of their personality and being funny but at the same time having all in control. I love this from both this show and shingeki no bahamut, the characters see a problem ACT in the moment, they just don't stand around looking like a post and panic, they do things, work together to overcome challenges. Thanks Cygames.

Also Gran is a fucking dunk master.
Is this as fun as the other Cygames adaptation (Bahamut)?
If Bahamut is the big epic fantasy then Granblue is the chill adventure show,
Nice. I like both chill and epic. Definitely watching this.

Reminder that big badass Bahamut also exist in the world of Granblue

(Yes, canonically Bahamut is able to live in multiple worlds, so the bahamut you see in this anime is technically the same as rage of bahamut)
Yeah. Saw the first episode and thought: "She's going to summon a Bahamut, isn't she?". And right I was. Definitely going to watch the rest.

This show feels much more simple than SnB, but that doesn't make it bad. Imo the strength of this show is in the great character designs and interactions. I like watching all these characters, and it feels more fun and lighthearted than SnB, which has many darker themes.
Gifs of [Gran dunking](http://imgur.com/a/M7oVf) and [smug sand slide](http://imgur.com/a/kMO6b)
The dunk is so low quality tho.
Wait Kamilny? The guy with the best girl on /r/ReZero? Yoo bro, internet is such a small place to find you here.
This is where I usually am. Surprised I'm remembered for that, it was months ago.

never mind the fact that he was on the ground after the dunk, so should have been completely buried in the sand,  not on top of it sitting down after, but there's a LOT of "artsy/for the luls" transitions in this episode that don't actually connect if you take even a second to think about it
What a pleasant surprise seeing Mary and Karva in the beginning. I sure hope that we will see all of the characters, even if it's just cameo.

What the hell is [this animal](https://i.imgur.com/Vd2VQHy.jpg) ?

Also : ranger/aventurer in front, followed by the gunslinger (i.e. fast ranged character), the mages in the middle, and a reliable fighter at the rearguard. That is a proper formation ! Learn something from it, DanMachi.

Not too sure why, but [the real treasure](https://i.imgur.com/utO9Gih.jpg) seems way too obvious. Not in a [bad kind of way.](https://i.imgur.com/tCEq0Jv.jpg) Maybe because it's screaming "unique weapon" ?
[storm rabbit](https://gbf.wiki/Storm_Rabbit)
I didn't noticed but in your first screen cap, theres some quality effort on the backgrounds holy shet.
That animal is a Storm Rabbit. It's a pretty common enemy in the browser game, especially in the early parts.

[When you have to fight a golem but ball is life](https://files.catbox.moe/7fnz0a.mp4)

This show is probably my hidden gem of the season. It's so unexpectedly good. [Indiana Jones reference](http://imgur.com/a/nWU2t) for anyone who missed it.

This episode had something the other episodes have lacked so far: personality. The two new girls were a lot of fun and there were some funny moments like Lyria's hair twitch, Rackam turning Gran around, and the slam dunk. I hope it keeps this direction, breaking from the fantasy stereotypes a bit.
Gran turning out to have Zero sense of direction is a really funny personality quirk to add to him, and yes, this is definitely the most actual character development the story has managed to date.
Up until this episode all the characters felt like standard archetypes. This episode they gave a lot of personality just with little reactions and lines.

Also Io getting flustered by Rackam was so damn cute lol. It was so refreshing to see all the ''party'' so chill and in control, no panic at all, not over-reaction ''see, a monster, lets get shit done'' not just standing around and getting fuck for no reason, everyone of them is a trope, yes, but all of them are toned down so much that the result is much more natural. Also finally getting some personality from Gran, it seems he was a loner as a child and still adjusting to be in a team (Also we discovered that Gran is a fucking NBA player). Literally the most under-rated fantasy anime of the season is becoming the best example on how to do ''classic JRPG'' show well. Glad that both  Shingeki no bahamut and GranBlue anime adaptations (both games from Cygames) are getting good direction.
I pretty much enjoy this anime. I hope we will get a second season, since I dont think we will reach some kind of end in the 6 episodes left

Cygames wants to make this a 4 season anime. LUL.

BLESS CYGAMES


(Now, really, they need at least 60 episodes to finish this thing decently, the game is long as fuck)
Four seasons would be pretty cool. Hopefully they manage to do that. With the amount of money Cygames has and how much the anime is supposedly selling, it can happen.
I really hope this happens
Knowing who Gran's Seiyuu is, I found that dunk scene to be even more amusing

You know Io doesn't seem that bad once you get used to her.

I like her quirks and interactions with everyone else.

Only her voice is annoying if you so find it.
I'm considering giving this anime a try. Does this have any connection to rage of bahamut? I mean, both are cygames and I think that giant clay thing is in shadowverse.

yes and yes, there's no "official word of god that's consistent, but RoB has already established that it's history repeats in cycles, so the general consensus is that GBF is either a newer or older loop in a serial timetine, or that they are all just parallel timelines considering the number of characters that simultaneously exist in all three games with very different stories in all three. The clay golem was actually only recently added to the GBF game as an SR summon, specifically tied to a shadowverse xover event.

Granblue also stablishes that various Bahamuts exists in various versions in various worlds at the same time "they're many but at the same time they're one".

Bahamut is the one in charge of resetting the world when he feels is the time to. He represents the cycle of life and death. He is not an evil guy, he is resurrection in physical form.

What i like about GranBlue is that Bahamut haves a completely different role. In the SnB anime Bahamut is the big baddie that should be stopped while in GBF Bahamut literally is part of the main crew since Lyria carries him inside her.

They are in different dimensions. The only overlapping character we will most likely see is Bahamut, since that is a multidimensional being. 

Though there is some who travels between dimensions (Daria where?!). 

Bahamut is a big epic fantasy show whereas Granblue is a pretty chill adventure series. Pretty good imo, and really beautiful.

Look at it as if they were parallel worlds. They share some characters. Still don't expect a story as dark as Shingeki no bahamut, this a much more early 90s classical JRPG take on the fantasy genre. If you don't mind that i would give it a try.

Shadowverse haves characters from both Rage of Bahamut and GranBlue Fantasy.
Ah, gotcha. Alright, I'll try it out then.

If you do ever end up trying out the Granblue Fantasy game as well, you might get some familiar characters you'd recognize from Shadowverse as well, like Arriet, Goblin Mage, Feena, Lucius, Teena, and of course Bahamut.
wow i didnt expect a filler episode with Mary in it. Was hyped for Eugen but seeing Mary animated was worth it.
The tsun-tsun between Rackam and Io is too stronk.

Now that was a fun episode that showcases the JRPG dungeon quests.

- Lyria should make use of her antenna ahoge more. LOL

- [Gran no Basket](http://imgur.com/a/M7oVf#X2YJVSo) - He's not exactly Kuroko's VA, but Taiga's not too bad. :3

- The two new adventurer girls are cute. Hope we see more of them in the near future.

This was a pretty fun episode! Plenty of laughs to be had, especially when Lyria's ahoge was moving on its own. And it's been ages since I last heard Akiko Hasegawa (Mary) in an anime, good to hear her voice again.

I have to say this was an unexpected episode. Filler, but still fun, and we get to see Mary and Karva. Incidentally, they're among my first ever gacha characters.

Now I wanna see an animated version of The Inner Light.
why the cow-like girls always stubby and have nice racks?

They are the Draph race, one of the four majority races in Granblue (the other three being humans, Erunes, and Harvins). Aside from humans, which is a human like us, the other races have unique physical traits. For instance, as mentioned by Katalina in previous episodes, Siero is a Harvin, basically a dwarf. 

The cow-like people are called Draphs, the teenage to adult females have the characteristics of being short and busty, while the adult males are always hulking and muscular (Tzaka for example).
oh... thanks
Also the female Draphs are known for having various kids each once reached adulthood.
so they have multiple but different kids each pregnancy?
Something like that, minor differences tho

Reminder that the birthrate of female draphs is pretty high :^).

Now, seriously, in the episode 6 if you saw the background characters literally every female draph had one or 2 little kids clinging to them, each one. Wich is suppose is natural since the Draphs follows the cow-bull type of race.
This episode riffed hard on Indiana Jones, and I'm okay with that.

I really liked episode, it had a lot of personality to it and just fun to watch. Im glad we gotten our first cameo and the scene with Lyria using her hair to sense Gran was soo amusing which brings up a small question...if Lyria senses Gran through her hair what does Gran use to sense Lyria...? I hope its not what i think it is XD

Oh also need to give props for that golem fight & b ball scene as well, up til the beginning I found Gran so freaking boring as a protagonist with little personality (still do) but that scene gave me hope of a chance for his character to get better all they need to do is give more fun moments like that and just make him just as vibrant as everyone else in the show.
Really fun episode. Everything was great. I'm loving the interactions between Io and Rackam. Lyria is adorable as always. Katalina is my best girl of course.
Would trade Io for those 2 other girls...Io seriously ruining this anime since she appeared in ep 6.  Can't think of a more annoying character since Kusano in Seikirei
*Io.
Why can't we have all three? Io was great in this episode, I love her character design.
Loving the Gran X Lyria pairing :)
